text: Does anyone have a vet they recommend in the Portland area? My crazy cat is due for her yearly check up. I’m just looking for another reason to make her hate me.
I would recommend Forever Pet Dental in Vancouver. They specialize in dental (obv.) but do full service vet care and have very fair prices for dental care.

The first vet I went to (Powell Vet) quoted >$500 for dental cleaning and I think this is fairly typical for regular vet clinics. FPD's quote is ~$195, so expensive, but reasonable given that they have to do full anesthesia
that's a good deal. For dogs I'm used to $1000 for dental cleaning
FPD does dogs too. Mo takes her dogs there and has been happy with them.
I live near the new building, off Stark. But I’m okay with traveling just about anywhere.
Fpd seconded!  For a first time visit the waiting list can be quite long.  Had to wait over 3 months
For dental care that is.  For other vet stuff I've been happy at Alberta veterinary

I took mush in to FPD for an emergency after an extraction (a swallowed string) and they were great (price & care). 
They offer to add more services with the cleaning for the convenience of being able to do other things while your pet is knocked out. For my cat this is pretty great because she is terrible at vet visits.
I take Richard to Dr Trerise at Parkway Veterinary in Lake Oswego. It's a trek, but I love them so much it's worth it!
Thanks for all the referrals! I really appreciate it :slightly_smiling_face:
